meanings.definition: A curve or bend in a coastline.
meanings.sent1: The ship sailed around the bight of the bay.
meanings.sent2: The coastline had a beautiful bight that jutted out into the sea.
meanings.sent3: The bight in the coastline made it a perfect spot for fishing.
meanings.sent4: The bight of the bay embraced the incoming waves like a protective arm.
meanings.sent5: The bight of the coastline was a natural wonder, attracting many tourists.

meanings.sent1: He secured the boat with a bight of rope around the dock.
meanings.sent2: The sailor quickly tied a bight in the rope to fasten the sail.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the bight of rope, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: The bight in the rope held firm, preventing the boat from drifting away.
meanings.sent5: She expertly created a bight in the rope to hang the hammock securely.

meanings.definition: A slack part of a rope.
meanings.sent1: He coiled the bight of the rope neatly to avoid tripping over it.
meanings.sent2: The bight of the rope hung loosely, waiting to be tightened.
meanings.sent3: The playful dog tangled itself in the bight of the rope during the game.
meanings.sent4: The bight of the rope swayed gently in the breeze, like a dancing snake.
meanings.sent5: She grabbed the bight of the rope to pull the heavy load with ease.
